god no, i just wanted to know which ones were for show; and if any of them were actually usable
if you're going to bother encrypting things you might as well use something thats not open to just about every trivial crypto attack there is
disk encryption in general is bullshit; but the novelty of some encrypted area is not
its for stuff that you can't let out of your possession without concious effort
you sound impassioned on the subject, are you in the security field?
so you did a fair amount of homework on the subject?

oddly enough wikipedia is a good enough resource for checking most of them out http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_disk_encryption_software but crypto is Hard(TM) and people just using it without knowing what they're doing can compromise even well conceived systems

even freeofte is a compromise, but it works with native things on the linux side (and being well fleshed out on the linux side, isn't ill concieved and awful :)
all security is a compromise and I don't think there are any absolutes in encryption, but the schemes are getting pretty good
you can't just tape it on and get any of the purported benefits of merely having it encrypted though; that it can't be grepped is like the smallest part of it :]
